definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet

sentences.english: Jane Zhang did a cover of this song during her performance at Super Girl.
sentences.chinese: 张靓颖在超级女声的比赛中表演过这首歌。

sentences.english: Then, several motorcycle march off, leaving the engine sound.
sentences.chinese: 接着，几台摩托车扬长而去，留下阵阵的引擎声。

sentences.english: The sound spelled "miaow" is used only in talking to people.
sentences.chinese: 发出的“喵喵声”只在与人讲话时使用。

sentences.english: The breaking surf on the reef is mesmerizing.
sentences.chinese: 拍打在礁石上浪涛声催人入梦。

sentences.english: But they were uttered only within his imagination.
sentences.chinese: 其实只是在他的想象之中发出了声。

sentences.english: The windshield wipers swished back and forth monotonously.
sentences.chinese: 挡风玻璃上的雨刷单调地来回摆动，发出飕飕声。

sentences.english: Sporadic gunfire from insurgents down the main road flies harmlessly overhead.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱分子零星的炮火声在主街道上空回荡。

sentences.english: As soon as the captain heard the sound of the lock being turned, he stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 一听到锁的转动声，船长就立刻一步跨世上前去。

sentences.english: With a scream of braking, the life of Yingzi flew up gently.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: Acoustic correlation velocity measurement technology is used to make measurements of velocity relative to the seabed.
sentences.chinese: 声相关测速技术可以测得舰船相对于海底的绝对速度。

sentences.english: They heard the clash of swords.
After a moment the barracking began.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，倒彩声开始响起。

sentences.english: He heard the stallion nicker. The first stars burned.
sentences.chinese: 他听到斯泰林的嘶鸣声。

sentences.english: Only they are mute incapable of speech.
sentences.chinese: 唯有他们是不能作声，不能说话的。

sentences.english: The actors were booed off the stage .
sentences.chinese: 演员被倒彩声轰下了台。

sentences.english: Dogs whimper when they're anxious or hurt.
sentences.chinese: 狗狗焦虑或者受到伤害的时候就会发车这种呜咽声。

definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
(of a sound) to come through/to be heard/(of news) to arrive
sharp and clear/crisp/melodious/ringing/tinkling/silvery (of sound)/fragile/frail/also written 輕脆|轻脆
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
